hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1439 a.n today's date is
December 4th 2017 and the thought of the
episode is central banks are worried
that people will realized they are
obsolete let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now it looks
like Wall Street wants to get involved
with crypto currencies and of course
they always go in a different direction
where they like to create derivatives
which are bets on bets on bets and it
looks like this is what they're doing
with Bitcoin right now now the CBOE
global market said that on Monday it
would begin trading its Bitcoin futures
contracts known as X BT futures and this
is supposed to start on December 10th
now both exchanges are hoping that
rising interest in cryptocurrencies from
Wall Street traders will help drive the
demand for its new derivative products
and we can see there are still traders
out there and those people that are in
the crypto market they're not too happy
about what is happening with this we
also see out in Venezuela that Maduro is
looking to completely bypass the dollar
now they were talking about using the
yuan the petrol yuan to trade oil and
he's thinking about coming up with a
cryptocurrency which would be backed by
oil reserves and they would be calling
it the petros this way they bypass the
dollar completely and if you notice
there has been a pattern where countries
are out there and they're trying to do
whatever they possibly can to bypass the
dollar and more and more countries are
doing this now what's very interesting
about the crypto market I mean it's
going up and up and up and many people
are saying it is a bubble maybe we are
approaching a bubble and we can see
there are many countries that are
jumping on the crypto market many people
are jumping on the crypto market the
central bankers they're a little bit
worried about the crypto market this is
why they're trying to create
laws where they're saying that they're
going after those individuals that have
more than 20,000 in Bitcoin they want to
tax those individuals and they're trying
to regulate it as best they possibly can
now remember the crypto market the
blockchain system and there's many
crypto currencies on the blockchain
system well they're completely on their
own you don't need a central bank you
don't need a bank you don't pretty much
need anything but I noticed that the
corporate media like Bloomberg and many
others they're out there saying well if
central banks can issue cash they can
issue crypto currencies now the question
is why don't we need a central bank
issuing a crypto currency there's no
need for a central bank to issue a
crypto currency this is what the central
banks are worried about they're worried
about crypto currencies growing and
people realizing that the central
banking system is completely obsolete
and actually it is obsolete there is no
benefit to a central banking system how
can there be a benefit to the people if
it's a private corporation they issue
they create the currency out of thin air
just like crypto currencies and they
loan it to governments with interest
cryptocurrencies there's no interest
attached and there's no cap on how much
they can create and we can see
throughout Europe look what happened to
Greece look what's happening to France
Spain and the rest of the countries
they're being put into debt and
eventually what happens when the debt
level gets very high they have to push
austerity here in the United States the
Federal Reserve just keeps on creating
the currency there's no end and the
government government officials they
just keep borrowing and what does that
do well it creates more and more debt
and the situation just gets worse and
worse as time goes on and as we can see
the
the central banks this is one of their
biggest worries this is why they've been
trying to get into the crypto market
this is why they're trying to create
their own coin saying they can stabilize
it but they don't realize and they don't
understand is that the people around the
world who deal in cryptocurrency they
understand that there's no reason to
even deal with a bank or to have a
central bank manage this what's very
interesting I was out and I heard people
talking about Bitcoin and it's the
younger generation I'm older I'm 52 I
heard younger individuals they must have
been in their late 20s or early 30s
and they were talking about Bitcoin
which is very surprising and they were
talking about how you don't need a bank
how you can use Bitcoin or the other
cryptocurrencies to pay for items where
you can use the cryptocurrencies and
receive it as a salary and there is
absolutely no reason to use banks at all
and I believe what's happening right now
is the younger generation right now is
looking at this saying there is
absolutely no reason we need a central
bank we need a banking system everything
can be handled right from the level of
the blockchain and that's that and they
were talking about it how much they've
purchased already how high they think
it's going to go and we can see already
that as we move forward well there's
going to be more people talking about
this and more people getting involved
more people understanding this and this
is what the central banks are very
worried about we see out in the retail
industry and I'm talking about the
brick-and-mortar stores we understand
that there is a lot of problems their
sales have not gone as well as the
corporate media as the government is
letting everyone know actually sales are
terrible traffic to the stores is awful
and you have to remember Amazon only
represents 3% yes 3% of the overall
US retail sales so when they try to make
it a really big deal that Amazon is
taking over the world with retail it's
three percent of US retail sales so
there is no Amazon effect it was made up
to convince you of why the retail market
was collapsing you know there are a
hundred and seventy thousand fewer
retail jobs in 2017 and no they didn't
all go to Amazon a very very tiny
percentage went over to Amazon tiny
miniscule the rest of the people have no
work or maybe they found a work in a

maybe in another retail store but we can
see right now that there are many jobs
being removed from the industry because
what do we have we have bankruptcies we
have stores closing and the traffic to
retail stores is dropping purchasing of
retail is dropping they don't want you
to know this because they want you to be
convinced they want you to be convinced
that everything is fine actually US
factory orders have slid in October
they've declined and we see right now
they are busy revising all the numbers
now October factory orders decline by
negative 0.1% and they were revised
upward in September from 1.4 percent to
1.7 percent month on month and durable
good orders were also revised higher
from their preliminary print it was down
by negative 0.5 percent and they made it
to eight point three percent gain so
what they're doing is they're very busy
manipulating all the numbers and making
sure people believe that everything is
fine well the manipulation is going to
come to an end because when people don't
have jobs when people aren't purchasing
in retail and they can't say oh it's the
Amazon effect they're gonna run into
trouble they ran into trouble where they
used to blame
on the weather oh retails not doing well
because it's snowed in the Northeast
well what about the rest of the country
oh well retails not doing well because
it rained or there was a hurricane in
Texas well what about the rest of the
country and this they can't use anymore
the Amazon effect that will come to an
end people will start to realize that
that is fake phony and false also we see
that the bubble watch is still going on
and we need to understand that this
everything bubble it is a bubble in
sovereign bonds it was created by the
central bank attempting to corner these
markets via zerp and QE now because
sovereign bonds are the bedrock for the
current financial system if they go into
a bubble everything goes into a bubble
now back in 2008 more than 80% of
non-financial corporate bond issuance
was rated a or above in the past five
years the proportion has been
consistently under 60% now what does
this mean this report is telling us that
even in 2008 a period that everyone
admits was a disaster in terms of debt
corporate bonds were less risky than
they are today that means the average
corporate bond is riskier than before at
the same time the reforms that followed
the crash of 2008 2008 mean that banks
have to hold more capital but this also
means they are less willing to devote
capital to market making so as a result
the bond market is less liquid than
before so investors in corporate bonds
are holding riskier less liquid assets
which is worse than 2008 and we can see
that things are really starting to
deteriorate it's getting worse and worse
as we move forward now for the first
time in modern history US government
debt will surpass household debt now
this is just unbelievable the federal
government liabilities increased almost
a hundred and fifty percent over the
same period and nearly reaching
household debt levels for the first time
in modern
history this tells us that things are
out of control it tells us that the
people cannot take on any more debt
there at their max the government has to
continually take on more and more debt
it needs to take on more debt because it
has to pay for all the programs it has
to pay for the wonderful health
insurance that the government has it
also has to pay for their salaries it
also has to make up for the declining
tax receipts that the government is
receiving there's also interest on the
debt and as we can see going back in
time well the debt keeps on rising it's
not going to end actually it accelerates
when these things all happen and that's
what we've been seeing since 2008 now
something very interesting there was a
new research a new report that came out
and it says that the Fed has no reason
to keep raising interest rates they're
saying that there's no reason for the
Fed to raise interest rates any more
well we know why they're saying this
because if they start raising interest
rates guess what the housing bubble pops
the student loan bubble pops the auto
loan bubble pops the bond market bubble
pops the stock market pops everything
feeds into everything else and
everything comes down so now they're
trying to make this case of why the Fed
doesn't need to raise interest rates now
this is coming from a former Fed
official they created he's an economics
professor at the University of Rochester
and they're creating this report to show
that there is no reason for the Fed to
do anything now the report says that the
Phillips curve is actually more like a
cliff it remains flat as long as the
actual output of the economy is below
its potential output once the output gap
closes inflation will spike upward and
this is when the Fed should raise rates
so the Fed is doing the opposite of the
appropriate policy at the moment he said
instead of gradually raising rates the
Fed should see how long it can make the
unemployment rate go
this might spark a will a virtuous
circle getting more people involved in
the labor market and sparked more demand
and capital investment which in turn
leads to more jobs well know the
unemployment numbers are fake they're
phony people aren't getting the high
paying jobs they're getting jobs in
retail which now they're getting laid
off they're getting jobs in restaurants
where the the foot traffic is slowing
down and the restaurant performance
benchmark is declining right now and
what is happening is we have no
manufacturing or very little bit of
manufacturing and there are no jobs in
the u.s. their service type of jobs or
someone sits behind a great cube with a
computer and answers emails all day this
is the major problem and the major
problem is that most of these statistics
that are coming out of the government
out of the Fed they've been manipulated
to make everyone believe that everything
is great and they're trying to make the
case right now of why the Fed doesn't
need to raise interest rates because if
they start raising interest rates the
whole thing just comes completely down
and they know this and they can't do
anything because everything will be
blamed on them so they're trying to push
this off as far as they possibly can and
while this is happening and again
anything could you know make this go
completely implode on itself we see the
actual economy
well it's imploding retail factory
output the tax receipts coming into the

falling apart it's all falling apart all
at the same time and they're having

and as we move forward it's going to
accelerate as we move into 2018 it's

and this is why they're trying to figure

look over here it wasn't us and
this is what they've been putting off
and they're trying to figure out a way

we can see that they're trying all

the central bank is the root of all evil
it all emanates from there and it just

everyone thanks a lot for listening be
